title: progress bar under ipython/jupyter web frontend should be redone
body:
ATM it is not "kosher": (disregard black rectangle artifact)
![screenshot](http://www.onerussian.com/tmp/gkrellShoot_06-05-17_121748.png)

edit 1:  on a quick look tqdm provides progress bar support for ipython  https://github.com/tqdm/tqdm#ipythonjupyter-integration  .
so the change as 
```
diff --git a/datalad/ui/progressbars.py b/datalad/ui/progressbars.py
index 07a595f4..77286a60 100644
--- a/datalad/ui/progressbars.py
+++ b/datalad/ui/progressbars.py
@@ -64,7 +64,7 @@ class SilentProgressBar(ProgressBarBase):
 progressbars = {'silent':  SilentProgressBar}
 
 try:
-    from tqdm import tqdm
+    from tqdm import tqdm_notebook as tqdm
     from datalad.support.external_versions import external_versions
     from datalad.utils import updated
```
allows to try it out
  The side-effects we ran into so far

- it would blow when trying to use and something didn't import nicely from ipython, so tqdm would end up without that IntProgress class from ipython
- after you install all kinds of packages on debian system (`apt-get install python-ipywidgets jupyter-nbextension-jupyter-js-widgets python-widgetsnbextension`), restart everything, it seems to work (there might be an additional command to run in the console to enable them) in the browser
- if you interrupt ongoing "datalad.get" (ie active progressbar), and then try to "drop" anything -- it would blow with closed pipe exception.  (edit 1 might be unrelated to progressbar actually and somewhat points to git module ... building fresh bugfix release to verify etc)
- if you try to use that from console (not web JS) -- nothing is output... so I wonder if we could decide at run time which of the progress bars to use depending on how ipython session is running for this command (web ui, or console)... although strange that we would need to do so -- should be done automagically at ipython level (or tqdm).
